701935f-a.folder: University Avenue & Sedgwick Avenue, Bronx, NY
701935f-a.text:
(1)
University Ave., north from its junction with Sedgwick Ave. (foreground). The 8-story building with the lighthouse tower bears No. 956 and is the home of the H.W. Wilson Co., publishers.
May 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the buildings which adjoin the Wilson Building, as seen across the car Tards of the Putnam Division of the New York Central Railroad on the west side of Sedgwick Ave. The low frame homes (right) are on the east side of the latter avenue.
May 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as view 2, from a point southward (about West 161st Street, as seen fro the small public park near the Harlem River).
May 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

701936f-a.folder: University Avenue & Sedgwick Avenue, Bronx, NY
701936f-a.text:
(1)
990 to U56 University Ave. (running from left foreground to right center), east side, at its junction with Sedgwick Ave., Also shown (extreme right) is Sedgwick Ave., south from its Junction with University Ave. The 8-story building with the licht tower is that of the H.W. Wilson Co., publishers. In the background appears the Harlem River and the Macombs Dam Bridge.
May 6, 1934.
(2)
The same, a more extensive view westward. Also shown are the tracks of the Putnam division of the New York Central Railroad and the Putnam Bridge. The Manhattan shore is visible on the west bank
of the river.
May 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

701762f-a.folder: Sedgwick Avenue & University Avenue, Bronx, NY
701762f-a.text:
Sedgwick Ave. (extreme right), east side, at its junction with University Ave., showing W.P.A. vorkmen constructing a wall which will separate the two avenues. The buildings shown on the left, face on the
east side of University Ave. The view is southward.
December 3, 1936.
Works Progress Administration.
Federal Art Project photo.

701763f-a.folder: Sedgwick Avenue & University Avenue, Bronx, NY
701763f-a.text:
Sedgwick Avenue, east side, at University Avenue, showing the wall, erected by the Works Progress Administration, separating the two thoroughfares. he view is south and shows the lighthousewtower building of the H.W.Wilson Co.,
publishers.
Sugust 19, 1937
W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project
(2)
The park area built by the W.P.A. on top of the Sedgwick
Avenue wall.
August 10, 1937
W.P.A.Photo
Five Boroughs Project
